Hauptplatz with Kornmesserhaus and eisernem Brunnen

is a small city located in the north of
was one of the most important trading centres in
, nowadays Bruck an der Mur is one of the major train hubs (two international train routes cross here) in
, so it's very likely that you come across this city while travelling through the country.
Getting in by train is fairly easy.
have hourly connections to Bruck an der Mur. Furthermore there are connections to
The nearest airports are located in
airports are also a good option.
If you get in by train, follow
, cross the bridge at the end of the road and follow
which takes you directly to centre of the city. (
) It's about 15 minutes by feet. Many of the city's sights are close to
and therefor it's a good place to start exploration.
Local bus lines No 1,2,3 and 30 take you around the city. All lines stop at the main station and the city centre. Tickets can be bought directly on the bus.
As in any bigger city, most of the parking space in the inner city is subject to fees and parking space may generally be rare during weekdays. There's a convenient parking garage at
, prices are around €2 per hour. Tickets for the short-term parking zones can be obtained from ticket machines on the streets.

value: - a beautiful Venetian-style house, built in the late 15th century located at
, this fountain has beautiful iron decorations which are unique within
. The fountain is at least 400 years old, since it has been mentioned in 1613 for the first time. (due to repair works)
- A village fair hold every second Saturday in August. Mainly dominated by jugglers.
- Carnival hold every year on November, 11th.
- Hauptplatz 11, 3862/54904 - located in the city centre a few minutes away from
. Has traditional cuisine, main dishes range from €10 to €16. Has seasonal speciality-weeks (such as asparagus) depending on the time of year.
content=Mittergasse 23. A cosy cocktail bar in the heart of the city. Has live-DJs.
- Am Wiener Tor 1. As you might expect, locals call the pub just
content=Am Schiffertor 3, - Has doubles for €98, including free access to the sauna.

. Well known for its stunning green color, this lake offers fantastic walks and is a perfect place for diving. (You need a valid diving license to dive there, there is no diving school) If you are travelling by car head for
. It will take about 30min to reach
